You can't use this service if the deceased lived outside England or Wales.

# Check you can use this service to apply for grant of representation  

## Applying for a grant of probate
 Up to 4 lay executors can apply, and none of the executors:
 * can be partners in your firm 
* can be represented by an attorney 
* can be unable to apply due to mental incapacity  

## Applying for letters of administration  
* only one person can apply
* the applicant must be a spouse or child of the deceased
* the applicant may not be represented by an attorney
* the applicant may not be unable to apply due to mental incapacity 
* there can be no minority interest
* the deceased must have died after October 2014
 
## Applying for letters of administration with will annexed  
## For all applications  
* the deceased must have been domiciled in England or Wales
* the value of the estate must have been reported to HMRC
 
## Saving your application

You’ll be able to save each section of your application after checking your answers. No information will be saved automatically.

## Paying for your application

You can pay by fee account or cheque.
Enter all executors named in the will. Only 4 lay executors can apply.
